sense.def:
To cross a room, road, or area of land
pomeni premikati se ali potovati na drugo stran sobe, ceste ali ozemlja.

To cross to a place
pomeni iti čez neko zemljišče ali vodo, da bi prišli na cilj.

seg.quote: He stood up at once and crossed to the door.
Where and how did you cross into Swaziland?

sense.def:
Če rečemo, da črte ali ceste
cross
, se srečajo in prekrižajo.

seg.quote: Brook Street runs west, crossing Bond Street.

sense.def:
To cross one's arms, legs, or fingers
pomeni dati eno roko, nogo ali prst čez drugega.

seg.quote: She sat back and crossed her legs.
A flicker of unconcealed distaste crossed his features.

sense.def:
Kadar neka misel
crosses one's mind
, človek na nekaj pomisli ali se spomni.

cit.quote: domisliti se, priti na misel, spomniti se

seg.quote: It had not crossed my mind to tell them I was leaving.

sense.def:
A cross
je lik, sestavljen iz navpične črte in krajše vodoravne črte, ki križa navpično. Je najpomembnejši simbol krščanstva.

A cross
je tudi zapisano znamenje v obliki črke X.

seg.quote: The reader has to indicate the answer with a cross or a tick.
We all get cross with our children.
‘Don't ask me,’ the post office lady replied, crossly.

sense.def:
Kar je
a cross between two things
, ni ne ena ne druga stvar, temveč mešanica obeh.

seg.quote: A Barbary duck is a cross between a wild duck and an ordinary duck.

sense.def:
To cross off items on a list
pomeni potegniti črto čez postavke na seznamu.

seg.quote: ...crossing off those who were no longer interested.

sense.def:
To cross out words
pomeni potegniti črto čez besede.

seg.quote: She saw her name and crossed it out.
